availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas A. Berryman (Owen County, Kentucky, attorney, chair of bd of trustees for Owenton)

body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, attorney and town trustee. New Kent County, Virginia, native. Married to Lucy H. Gower Berryman in Owen County, Kentucky, on May 4, 1824. Father of Ann Mary Berryman and Lucy Wells Berryman. Attorney in Owen County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Owen County in 1850. Attorney in Owen County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Owen County in 1860. Chairman of the board of trustees for the town of Owenton in 1862.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 182A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, Owenton, p. 285A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Owen County Marriages, 1819-1941, Film #001943448, p. 1.
